meanings.definition: The walls of a cavity or hollow structure.
meanings.sent1: The parietes of the cave were covered in ancient drawings.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the parietes of the heart for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The parietes of the room seemed to be closing in on me, making me feel trapped.
meanings.sent4: The parietes of the fortress stood strong against the enemy's attacks.
meanings.sent5: I could feel the rough texture of the parietes as I ran my hand along the wall.

meanings.definition: The outer layer of an organ or structure.
meanings.sent1: The parietes of the skin protect our body from external harm.
meanings.sent2: The parietes of the tree bark were rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The parietes of the cake were decorated with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: The parietes of the building shielded its inhabitants from the storm outside.
meanings.sent5: The parietes of the fruit were firm and ripe, ready to be eaten.

meanings.definition: The boundaries or limits of a space.
meanings.sent1: The parietes of the garden marked the edge of the property.
meanings.sent2: The parietes of the field stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent3: The parietes of the classroom seemed to expand as more students entered.
meanings.sent4: The parietes of the city were bustling with activity and life.
meanings.sent5: The parietes of the forest were dense with trees and undergrowth.
